briefdescription.para: Internals of DBusPendingCall.

detaileddescription.para: Opaque object representing a reply message that we're waiting for. shorter and more visible way to write _dbus_connection_lock()

briefdescription.para: shorter and more visible way to write _dbus_connection_unlock()

memberdef.argsstring: (DBusPendingCall *pending_call, int old_refcount, int new_refcount, const char *why)
memberdef.name: _dbus_pending_call_trace_ref

briefdescription.para: Creates a new pending reply object.

parameterdescription.para: length of timeout, -1 (or DBUS_TIMEOUT_USE_DEFAULT) for default, DBUS_TIMEOUT_INFINITE for no timeout
timeout handler, takes pending call as data

simplesect.para: a new DBusPendingCall or NULL if no memory.

briefdescription.para: Sets the reply of a pending call with the given message, or if the message is NULL, by timing out the pending call.

parameterdescription.para: the message to complete the call with, or NULL to time out the call

briefdescription.para: Calls notifier function for the pending call and sets the call to completed.
If the pending call hasn't been timed out, add its timeout error reply to the connection's incoming message queue.

parameterdescription.para: the connection the call was sent to

briefdescription.para: Checks to see if a timeout has been added.

simplesect.para: TRUE if there is a timeout or FALSE if not

briefdescription.para: Sets wether the timeout has been added.

parameterdescription.para: whether or not a timeout is added

briefdescription.para: Retrives the timeout.

simplesect.para: a timeout object or NULL if call has no timeout

briefdescription.para: Gets the reply's serial number.

simplesect.para: a serial number for the reply or 0

briefdescription.para: Sets the reply's serial number.
Gets the connection associated with this pending call.

simplesect.para: the connection associated with the pending call

briefdescription.para: Gets the connection associated with this pending call.

simplesect.para: the connection associated with the pending call

briefdescription.para: Sets the reply message associated with the pending call to a timeout error.

parameterdescription.para: the message we are sending the error reply to

briefdescription.para: Increments the reference count on a pending call, while the lock on its connection is already held.
Decrements the reference count on a pending call, freeing it if the count reaches 0.

detaileddescription.para: Assumes connection lock is already held.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether the pending call has received a reply yet, or not.

simplesect.para: TRUE if a reply has been received

briefdescription.para: Stores a pointer on a DBusPendingCall, along with an optional function to be used for freeing the data when the data is set again, or when the pending call is finalized.

detaileddescription.para: The slot number must have been allocated with dbus_pending_call_allocate_data_slot().

simplesect.para: TRUE if there was enough memory to store the data

briefdescription.para: Increments the reference count on a pending call.
Decrements the reference count on a pending call, freeing it if the count reaches 0.
Sets a notification function to be called when the reply is received or the pending call times out.

parameterdescription.para: data to pass to notifier function
function to free the user data

briefdescription.para: Cancels the pending call, such that any reply or error received will just be ignored.

detaileddescription.para: Drops the dbus library's internal reference to the DBusPendingCall so will free the call if nobody else is holding a reference. However you usually get a reference from dbus_connection_send_with_reply() so probably your app owns a ref also.

Note that canceling a pending call will not simulate a timed-out call; if a call times out, then a timeout error reply is received. If you cancel the call, no reply is received unless the the reply was already received before you canceled.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether the pending call has received a reply yet, or not.

simplesect.para: TRUE if a reply has been received

briefdescription.para: Gets the reply, or returns NULL if none has been received yet.

detaileddescription.para: Ownership of the reply message passes to the caller. This function can only be called once per pending call, since the reply message is tranferred to the caller.

briefdescription.para: Block until the pending call is completed.

detaileddescription.para: The blocking is as with dbus_connection_send_with_reply_and_block(); it does not enter the main loop or process other messages, it simply waits for the reply in question.
If the pending call is already completed, this function returns immediately.

xrefdescription.para: when you start blocking, the timeout is reset, but it should really only use time remaining since the pending call was created. This requires storing timestamps instead of intervals in the timeout

briefdescription.para: Allocates an integer ID to be used for storing application-specific data on any DBusPendingCall.

detaileddescription.para: The allocated ID may then be used with dbus_pending_call_set_data() and dbus_pending_call_get_data(). The passed-in slot must be initialized to -1, and is filled in with the slot ID. If the passed-in slot is not -1, it's assumed to be already allocated, and its refcount is incremented.
The allocated slot is global, i.e. all DBusPendingCall objects will have a slot with the given integer ID reserved.

parameterdescription.para: address of a global variable storing the slot

briefdescription.para: Deallocates a global ID for DBusPendingCall data slots.

detaileddescription.para: dbus_pending_call_get_data() and dbus_pending_call_set_data() may no longer be used with this slot. Existing data stored on existing DBusPendingCall objects will be freed when the DBusPendingCall is finalized, but may not be retrieved (and may only be replaced if someone else reallocates the slot). When the refcount on the passed-in slot reaches 0, it is set to -1.

parameterdescription.para: address storing the slot to deallocate

briefdescription.para: Stores a pointer on a DBusPendingCall, along with an optional function to be used for freeing the data when the data is set again, or when the pending call is finalized.

detaileddescription.para: The slot number must have been allocated with dbus_pending_call_allocate_data_slot().

simplesect.para: TRUE if there was enough memory to store the data

briefdescription.para: Retrieves data previously set with dbus_pending_call_set_data().

detaileddescription.para: The slot must still be allocated (must not have been freed).

parameterdescription.para: the slot to get data from

simplesect.para: the data, or NULL if not found
